section.title: Horizon Timeout
section.p: The default session timeout for Horizon is 1800 seconds or 30 minutes. This is the recommended default and best practice for those concerned with security.

As an administrator, you can change the session timeout by changing the value of the SESSION_TIMEOUT to anything less than or equal to 14400, which is equal to four hours. Values greater than 14400 should not be used due to Keystone constraints.
section.note: Increasing the value of SESSION_TIMEOUT increases the risk of abuse.

section.title: Steps
section.p: Follow these steps to change and commit the Horizon timeout value.

ol.li: Edit the Horizon config file with the editor of your choice (nano, vim, vi, etc): cd ~/helion/my_cloud/config/horizon/ vim local_settings.py

By default, the SESSION_TIMEOUT entry doesn't exist in the Horizon configuration file local_settings.py. If this is the case, add an entry above the SESSION_ENGINE line/entry like so: SESSION_TIMEOUT = 14400 If there is an existing entry for SESSION_TIMEOUT, change its value to suit your needs. Do not exceed the stated upper bound of 14400.
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "Update Horizon SESSION_TIMEOUT"
Prepare to reconfigure the cloud with the change: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Reconfigure Horizon: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts horizon-reconfigure.yml
